review: I went here this last monday, later in the evening to get a to-go and there were two huge groups there eating in. I sat at the bar and drank a water while waiting for my food, and the bartender was very nice and attentive, even though they were packed and I was just waiting on to-go food. It did take a while; however everyone was already really busy and they were all still checking in on everyone.  My food came and was still good after the drive home. I would recommend to anyone dining in or taking out.

FOOD: Tavern Burger ($6.99) I ordered was good. Raspberry iced-tea ($2.89) was excellent.  SERVICE: I received bad service from my waiter at the bar. My bottomless steak fries, actually reached to the bottom. After my first serving of fries, I had to ask for seconds. To make the matter worse, while waiting for them, my waiter brought my check on his own. To me, that was rude.  I would return to Red Robin, but not this location. I don't like it when they claim it is bottom less and I have to ask for more; or when I am being rushed.

Once you've been to one Red Robin you've been to them all. The burgers are ok, I like the buffalo style chicken strips and fries....or clucks and fries I guess is what they are called. The service is usually pretty good. On a different note I got an electric watermelon here and it was the best one I've ever had!! Happy Hour before a movie was good.

I was very amazed by the level of service I received from my waiter Lukas, I eat out almost every day and here at Red Robin I received some of the best service ever, drink refilled before it was empty, very on top of the bottomless fries and seemed to be genuinely concerned that I was enjoying my food and enjoying myself, very awesome five stars.

This particular location is a model of inconsistency. I've had fabulous meals here, better than pretty much anywhere I've ever eaten.....and I've had horrific meals here. I wish I could understand what the difference is, but we always order the same thing, so I just chalk it up to half-ass management and staff. I've had great experiences in the bar area, and had really terrible ones too.  I've been taken care of the dining room and I've been shafted in the dining room.  Sometimes the wait staff is good, sometimes they suck.  Sometimes the kitchen staff is on, sometimes not so much. I think we've given them plenty of chances....when I need the YUMM! of Red Robin, I'll drive to Covington, Southcenter or South Hill.

I would like to thank each an every person at this location I believe that they truly understand the true meaning of Customer Service they accommodated me an my friend that was with a walker are server was wonderful to the host to the managers great ,great job  keep up the friendly service
It's a pretty typical Red Robin. The staff is pretty friendly and attentive when we go for lunch. The food also comes out pretty quickly as they know that people need to get back to work.

I always enjoy Red Robin and this time was no different!  Our waiter was fantastic and we never had to ask for refills and our food came out in a timely fashion and he didn't disappear after our food was delivered!

Had never been to this location and my oldest got a coupon for a free birthday burger - so we decided to have her birthday lunch here after shopping. The host was super friendly (almost to friendly....), waitress was very good and manager stopped by to wish Happy Birthday and make sure everything was good. Definitely the best service we've ever had at a RR. I had their French Onion Soup (which is great - the only better IMHO is 13 Coins), little one had her cheeseburger kids meal (only $4.99), oldest had a traditional cheeseburger and a strawberry shake (really good and love that they give you the extra).  Total was $20.00 with tax and tip. Would definitely considering eating here again...

I guess it's been a long time since I have visited red robin since they have made quite a few changes to the menu, food, and how they serve the food. Not a fan on they serve burgers now way too messy!  But the service was top notch. Michael in the bar was on it very quick service!

Haven't been to red robin in a while and I was surprised at how it has changed for the worse. Three of us had the signature red robin cheeseburger. They used to wrap them in a napkin. They don't anymore. They used to add a crisp piece of lettuce, an onion with some bite, and a slice or two of fresh tomato. They don't anymore. Now it is shredded lettuce, pieces of tomato and onion in name only. The burger itself used to be a juicy piece of meat. Now the patty is big enough but comes with the life cooked out of it. The fries used to be big steak fries but now they are just shards of steak fries but you can still have as many as you want. On leaving the waitress asked if I had had enough. I had to say yes. Enough for a lifetime.

After dining here I checked my bank account and realized they had charged me two times for my meal. That is not a expectable mistake. Will stay away from this location in the future. ... But their campfire sauce is the bomb!!

I've had both good and bad experiences with Red Robin. Sometimes I think my expectations are perhaps a little high for what this chain restaurant is capable. The bad first- The service is always hit or miss. Sometimes you get an energetic and engaging server on a slow night and everything goes smoothly. Sometimes you get a burnt out server at the end of a double shift with a full section.  Now, the good- The food is consistently decent. The "gourmet" in their name might be misleading. Yes, they have bot traditional and funky burger creations with interesting flavors, but don't expect Iberico ham or duck eggs. The ambience is good for kids. My little one can stare for hours at the nostalgia on the walls and even when it's busy I never feel like it's terribly loud. Oh yeah- Bottomless fries. You'll need a server that's on the ball if you really wanna take advantage of the bottomless fries, but this is by far my favorite thing about RR.
I enjoyed the wait staff. Food was good. Wait was ok, but was awkward to wait standing up for so long.

i'm deducting a star for Red Robin in general - They used to be a fan place to grab a burger, bottomless fries, and kind of care free fun.  In the recent months of my coming back, I've noticed numerous changes.  The menu is becoming more "fancy" as it's a booklet style similar to Cheesecake Factory.  The bottomless basket of fries is now a metal cylinder with no bottom that typically holds about 10 fries at best.  The (my personal former favorite) Royal Red Robin Burger is now served as an "open face burger" and the egg is cooked over easy contrary to the original over hard.  Red Robin no longer carries Tabasco but as switched over to Cholula.  The overall quality of the burger and fries seemed to have gone down a touch while prices have jumped about 50 cents. Call me old school and a bit nostalgic for things of the past but I enjoyed getting my burger and fries in a basket.  It's more comfortable and fun.  I don't care to pay a little more to make things look fancy on a plate.  Red Robin prior to changes had some of the best steak fries around!  Now in my last two visits, they've been a little soggy and just small end pieces that are either soggy or over cooked.   Burgers have different breads that I wasn't aware of.  And why can't my egg still be cooked over hard?  Over easy is the only option you have, I personally don't like yoke dripping off my burger when I eat, you don't taste the egg anymore. Freckled lemonades used to be full of strawberries now you're lucky to get more than a few chunks and it seems more watered down as well. Cholula is NOT hot sauce.  It's tangy.  I know it's a matter of personal preference but I miss the hot heat spice of Tabasco.  Why not have a choice?  Why make it one or the other?? I could only guess this is corporate's way of cutting costs by switching to a different brand of hot sauce, lessening the amount of fries in front of people so non-burger orders cannot share bottomless fries by limiting how many is served at a time and to slow down people literally eating all the fries they can.  Also raising the prices by a small margin of 50 cents won't deter a consumer from eating but definitely pays for the revamp of the new menus and the plates the food comes on as well as boosts profit margins. /rant. It's just not that good anymore.

Burgers are OK certainly far from fantasic. Fries are very good, but like another reviewer stated, the bottomless fries come in a small basket that holds 10-12 fries at most. Gets a bit old having to ask for a refill every few minutes. Maybe they should revisit things like this. Not much of a cost savings if the wait staff is constantly running back and forth to the kithcen. Staff is friendly though. Hopefully, they actually take time to read this feedback.

You can always count on Red Robin for an exceptional meal, even for being a chain restaurant. My meal, the bacon cheeseburger was sizzlingly delicious and, As usual, the fries were to die for! Our waitress, I forgot her name, was great! She was wonderful with our younger guests! The only downside was that the wait time was a bit lengthy for being 3:00 in the afternoon, about 15-25, minutes. I would definitely recommend this Red Robin!

Food was terrible. Between 4 orders, three were messed up.  Worse yet, a chicken burger was partially raw. Then, the manager promised to comp part of the meal, but only gave us a gift certificate "for our next visit". We're not going back!

this was just a quick hh stop before heading home.   nothing extraordinary here.  staff was quick to us.  the usual bar food...i wish there were a few more options to choose from.   we grabbed some wings and chips this time.    although not spectacular, it's going to be pretty consistent for what it is.

Great food an service! The burgers are always cooked they way that I want and never ending fries are a good bonus. My husband I are on a strict no salt diet and they do an amazing job at catering to our diet needs buy no salt on your order when asked! I  say come and  try out this location!

Yesterday my family decided to give Red Robin one more shot.  We had never gone there during the week before, and we thought that might mean less of a wait.  Sure enough, no wait.  In fact, unlike previous times, we had an EXCELLENT super attentive server named Peirry.  She waited on us right away, she even recommended this new sauce they have, she brought it to go with our fries but did not charge us for it.  Our appetizer of cheesesticks and fried zuchinni was excellent.  Peirry kept our water glasses full, our burgers and fries were also cooked to perfection.  She brought us more fries than we could eat, which is a good thing as before we have had to flag down the server to get more fries and it would take forever.  The service was so fantastic I can't say enough good things about it!   If management is reading this, you need to give Peirry a raise.  She is the best server we have ever had and she was also making jokes!  So friendly, a great sense of humor and she knows her job!  We'd definitely go back on a weekday! :)

My friends and I stopped in for a quick bite... it turned into a long drawn out ordeal.  It seems like this location always has a long wait of at minimum 25 minutes.  We didn't want to try to go somewhere else because there isn't many sit-down restaurants in this area.  After we finally got seated we ordered and it didn't take long to get our drinks. But it seemed the waitress had too many tables because we didn't get much help.  After we finally got our food after waiting 35+ minutes we asked for more fries... supposed to be bottomless... well after waiting another 20 minutes we got 2 baskets with literally 5 fries in each. So as a group of 4 we ordered more..  again supposed to be bottomless... well we got no drink refills and again after waiting another 20+ minutes we got 2 baskets with 5 fries in each.  Seriously???  Not so bottomless on the fries...  The restaurant was packed and busy so there was junk all over the floor, screaming kids and it was loud from too many people talking at once. In all the food itself is decent but a little pricey. But make sure you have at least 2 hours set aside to eat here because there's nothing quick or efficient about Red Robin.

Always a great and friendly place to take the kids.  I had mad bad experiences at red robin in kent years ago and didn't go for  years. Until I went back to the one in auburn they blew me away.  For Cost friendly with many options for kids. The staff is always great too.

Always a good experience when I come here.  Good food and fast service.  Excellent drinks and a good variety on the menu.   Our waitress tonight was Pairy and she was outstanding.  So energetic and friendly.  First waitress I've ever had that learned out first names and used them throughout the meal.
40 minutes to get a seat. Appetizers took forever. This place always seems busy. Try another red Robin if you can or run over to Wendy's next door if you don't want to wait forever to be seated!

We had a pretty good experience with our server, Blake, and this was on a Saturday. But the food temperature was not hot enough. The value we recieved for what we spent was not very good. Red Robin used to a great value and much better food quality. The manager stopped by our table and even agreed with us.
Better packaging on their fish and chips. Fish used to get a bit soggy, now the fries are separated an have some vent holes for the steam. Nice change.

We were seated in the bar at a table in the bar where the table was sticky and large food crumbs that were all over the table. The server kindly wiped the table down and seemed pleasant. We ordered appetizers and the plates that came with them were covered in used sauce and stuck together. How the hell does this happen? We walked out. Thanks for the awesome lunch, you dirty birds.

What is worst than the food here? The services. Because of my possible early onset dementia, I often forget about how terrible my experience, I tend to come back. Please, save your tastebuds, don't suffer. Bad food is one thing but there is no excuse for the consistent bad customer services! I'm totally against fast food joint but I would rather recommend those places than going to this place... Or, just starve. Their theme chant should be changed to "Red robin... Yuck." You've been warned!

Hubby and I have started calling Red Robin, "The Dirty Birdy".  Let's face it... this place is pretty gross. It also seems like everything in the restaurant is covered in a layer of little kid germs.  In fact, the french fries are the only things that keep me frequenting any Red Robin location. I love those damn fries...  Anyway, this was our one and only experience at this location. We had abysmal service and everything besides the french fries was mediocre at best. The ladies room was dirty and seemed neglected.

Of the two local Red Robin's - this is our preference (gave the other one 2 stars).    We have been coming to Red Robin for over 40 years and have watched them slowly go downhill. The burgers are OK - not as thick as I recall and although you can still get them pink inside - they are not always juicy.   I called ahead to let them know that 9 of us were coming so they could consider getting tables together but they said  - not something they do.   NOTE - I was not expecting a reservation but when they are seating for the next 10 minutes they could keep the large group in mind and start planning.   Service is marginal half of the time but if you call for a manager - they will usually try to make it right.    The ambiance is fun and the kids do love it.   (come on a night when the Red Robin visits)    I might be comparing this to upper end chains and I need to reduce my expectations down to the lower ends - slightly above fast food.

Red Robin serves fun food in a fun atmosphere. It's great for kids and adults, as well. There are all kinds of burgers, salads, alcoholic beverages, and desserts.  We got excellent and timely service, just not very accurate service. We got our food pretty quickly, but it wasn't correct. The staff kept bringing us wrong food. One of my dining partners requested a lettuce-wrapped burger, but it came out with a bun. He also received regular fries instead of sweet potato fries. Another dining partner got dressing on the salad when it was asked for on the side. Then, there was the wrong sauce brought to the table several times. I guess they were just having an off day. But, in general this is a great, upbeat place to eat and they're usually pretty good about customizing your order - just not this time.

We've been going here for quite a while, 3 - 4 years.  The last couple of times I've had crap for service.  My food showed up 40 minutes after ordering, ice cold.  Tonight the waitress tried, and tried, and tried.  She was working her arse off but wasn't getting any support from the staff behind the counter.  The manager finally got a hot plate out to me, after my mother had half finished her dinner.  He apologized profusely and comped both of the meals.  The manager got an earful from me, the waitress got her tip ($5.00), and I resolved to find a different Red Robin.
Fair prices and decent food.  But every one we have been to feels like it needs cleaning.  There is a greasy feel to the place.  From the tables to the floors.

I don't know what happened. Either RR has gone downhill or my expectations as an adult have gone up.  Either way... RR isn't what I remember it to be as a teenager.  The service is never great, and the visit (about a week ago) was no exception.  The Banzai Burger was delicious, but the long wait for our server at numerous occasions was discouraging. (This includes a refill for our sweet potato fries that came back lukewarm.)  I think from now on, if I am craving a Banzai I'll just sit up at the bar or get it to go.

I've been a fan of red robin for a long time. They have good food at decent prices,  and their royalty rewards are good too. Every Tuesday during football season they do a BOGO on their Reds Tavern Double burger. Today the bartender was awesome, her name is Sam and she was very thorough with our to-go orders. Our lunches are limited to 30 minutes so her efficiency and attention were greatly appreciated.

As a rule I'm not a big fan of red Robin. However, this particular visit went very well because a very good service. The food is the same old same old typical red Robin greasy burgers and fries. But the service was above and beyond. I've been here a number of times and the excellent service we receivedyesterday really made the difference. Our visit was enjoyable and caused me to write this review. Thank you red Robin at Auburn!!
I eat here all the time. Great burgers, good prices. Football is almost always on. Great place to go!

Did someone walk into a Red Robin a while back and say " I sure wish they would put my burger on a plate instead of a basket and why can't they put my "bottomless" fries in a steel ring that looks like a car part ? That's what I really want "   How about you go back to baskets , give people a basket of fries with their food like you used to , and take the car parts to a recycler ?  This sounds like one of those ideas that some cement head in accounting thought up , less food but more presentation...  Know your customers , Red Robin....

Personally I love red robin even when I was a teenager it would be our Friday night dinner. Our server Sue was very polite and on point. Her suggestions where great! I live in Auburn and will visit this restaurant again :) great job staff and chefs really friendly atmosphere and people!high 5...

Fries tasted old and cold. The burger meat quality was terrible. My husband and I both disliked our burgers. Meat very chewy and grisly. Terrible burgers. The mix drinks were ok and poured heavy.  Service was ok.

Stopped in for my boyfriends birthday on Sunday and was a little irritated because pretty much nothing went right. We ordered our food and I ordered a side of buzz sauce and parmesan cheese. I didn't receive the parmesan cheese so I waited until our server came by to ask but she didn't drop our food off so she was nowhere to be found. About ten minutes went by and she finally came to check on us. I reminded her about my side that was forgotten and she disappeared for about 15 more minutes. Finally returned with two half full sides of it. By then my drink was empty. She ran off before I could ask for a refill. Finally when she came back, we asked for refills and then she brought me two diet cokes in a row, when I ordered regular coke. I was trying to be polite and courteous, because it seemed to me that she was new. For that reason, I won't say her name. But I think better training needs to happen or something.. Or don't leave new employees to themselves until they're comfortable. Anyways, when I told her that my second coke was in fact diet, she argued with me and said it was not diet. Mmmkay. So since it was my boyfriends birthday, she said he'd get a birthday sundae which he also never got. We ordered the dessert and asked to have it as soon as it was ready, but we had to ask for it three times after we were long finished with our food. Overall- I would give them another shot because everyone can have an off day, but I was seriously disappointed when we went out for what should've been a relaxing birthday lunch.

Sat in the bar, the waiter was super friendly, came to check on us just the right amount of times & made quick conversation every time.  The food here has always been sub-par to me. I'm not a huge hamburger fan so I never order burgers. Usually I get clucks & fries - which isn't any different than any other chicken strips. Their fries are pretty good & dipped in ranch...yum.  Tonight I got their soup & salad, the chowder wasn't anything spectacular. I can get the same stuff in a can at the grocery store. The salad was gross, I hardly ate any of it.  I don't mind eating here, this location has always been great service. & I know the clucks & fries are an okay go-to when someone suggests this restaurant. This is the best Red Robin service wise to go to though.
This burger joint is great. I love the bottomless root beer float. The menu has ample variety. The staff is friendly.

American food. Semi slow service. Waited awhile for the waiter to come back to ask for what my order would be. Good selection of food. Have been to various locations many times. Their pretzel bites and sweet potato fries are nice to munch on while talking with friends. $5-10.

Normally, I am a Red Robin fan. Not today. Don't get me wrong, my salad was fine. Actually one of the best I've had in a long time. Unfortunately, it was missing the accompanying ciabatta. It also didn't help that our server started her conversation with us by complaining that her section had been seated all at once. I know that to be false, as the other party of 8 waiting to be seated at the same time, yes we had to wait for a bit, was seated in eyesight, but in another section.  Service here, as always needs work.
I love Red Robin...  Sevice at this location is hit or miss.  We were just there and they are remodeling. Excited to see what it will look like.

Stopped in with a friend for a quick bite at the bar the other day.  It was slow in the bar, not many customers, and the service was a bit slow too.  The food was good, but it was not hot and fresh- probably sat under the heat lamp for a bit while we waited for the server to bring it.  The endless fries were hit and miss -  one batch was served luke warm (again, it probably sat under the heat lamp) but the next batch was hot, crisp and fresh.  Consistency would be appreciated.  Small mix up with the bill, but it was quickly resolved in a friendly manner.  I would give the location another try--everyone has an off day.

We've been to this location a few times in the last few months. We always sit in the bar, at the bar. And every time we've been served by Bartender Ryan. Super cool guy. Works hard. Always running around doing something. Good has been good and the drinks exceptional. A perfect place to eat before going to a movie.

Food was great!! The new remodel looked so much better than before and looks a lot more clean.   The reason why I am only rating this place 3 stars is due to the experience. Our waitress wasn't so friendly. She had forgotten our water and kept coming back to the table asking what we needed again. It just felt we weren't being cared for.  Our family enjoyed the food and we wanted to order desert, but due to the experience we weren't to happy and decided to leave so we don't have to deal with the EXPERIENCE.
This bartender girl is amazing I have been here many times and she is the greatest. Highly entertaining and fun. This keeps me coming back every time!!
Never been a fan, but they market towards kids. Family event. 6 people. Wait for a table is 20 minutes. Bar tv's showing reruns instead of the Espy's. Had low expectations and still disappointed
Service is good, pleasant reception and food is good. The coldest beer in town...........

Most of the waiters are friendly and attentive. Sometimes the wait can't be long but it's worth it. Food is great. I probably wouldn't like it as much if it wasn't for the fries, love the endless fries! They recently added things to their menu, most of them are delicious but they changed their kids menu, more variety but no refill on the mac and cheese and spaghetti.

Waited 10 min until I flagged down the manager to order drinks. Food took 40 minutes and had to flag down for refills. Fries were cold........ Refill On Fries were cold...... Disappointing for sure. We won't be back to this one. Also bathroom was disgusting smelled and garbage was overflowing on the floor

The food is what's to be expected of Red Robin, decent but nothing to write home about. I am reviewing this location in particular only because I live nearby. It kinda trips me out that the bar closes so early, but then again people probably don't often go into Red Robin after 10. Usually the service is good here and they never make mistakes on my food. However, they could keep the place cleaner. Wipe down the tables more often, check the bathrooms more, and vacuum the place for sure.
Red Robin has the best honey mustard out there... hands down.

Everytime we stop in to eat here I want to like it because I love Red Robin but, it's always filthy! Everything always feels so sticky and unclean. The last time we went, there were tables that were dirty when we got there and by the time we left the same table were still dirty. Maybe they are understaffed? For now I try to avoid going to this Red Robin and drive to a different one.

For Red Robin the Auburn location is better than most. I am not a big chain person but at least Auburn knows how to work with customers. Red Robin is always a noisy place because large groups go here and birthdays and what not so not my fav but its close to where other people i know are so sometimes it is a go to. I give it 3/5. I am not saying anything bad about it but I am not saying its top of the charts.
Good food. Clean inside. No wait time if you go early. Sometime staff is pushy and wants you to sit in the bar area. We don't drink. Lots of healthy choices.
Comfortable, tasty. I appreciate being able to swap out vegetables for fries. I would give five stars but they changed the way they make the Mudd Pie.

So where I am from we do not have Red Robin. We see the commercials  all the time and it looks good. Finally being here in seattle, it is a must try place. Food is great and what even greater is the bottomless endless fries.  When we got seated, we were seated a bit higher than the ground. I though it was funny they had a sign on the table that said "Watch your step or well LOL." If this is your first time you have to try the onion ring. It comes in a short or tall tower. Order the short tower if you are planning to eat something else. It is quite filling. I love that when you bit into the onion ring the onion does not fall apart. :) I had order one of the new burger and I must say it was ono.. Lots of flavor, but it is a bit messy. By the time I ate half of my burger I was full because of the endless fries and onion ring  I ate. This place is awesome. I have yet to come back again and try their alcohol shakes. They have different types of shakes. they have a gunnies shake, a blue moon shake, and many more.

Wish I could give a 1/2 star for this joint. Do not come here for a Saturday night dinner. There is no organization & they are obviously short on staff.  Food was also disappointing. They're new menu that's enticing but they still need work, lots of work. What could've been a easy hour dinner ends up being 2 hours long.  Our change took forever.  But it seems that managers are too busy talking to their hostesses, rather than just going & changing TVs when a patron asks their server 3Xs first & can't get the manager to change it.  I finally walked over & asked the manager.  He still took another 6 min. to change the TV.   Portions on these specialty sandwiches, needs rethinking.  What happened to the cute silver fries cup holder ???  Big Disappoint.
Really good burgers..sorta pricy but not nearly as expensive as five guys.....when in the area its the preffered burger joint to go to..never had a poor experience..

Worst. experience. Ever. I came here with my sisters to celebrate my birthday, it was 3 of us.  We were seated by Caitlin, our waitress and she took our orders. It probably took half an hour to bring 2 burgers.  We ordered freckled lemonade- this never came. We tried getting a refill on our fries- took over 30 minutes and she kept asking if we are done. We asked for honey mustard, she kept telling us it's coming- never came.  She asked me if I want a birthday sundae to go- lol.  Everyone else around us with different waitresses literally came after us, got their food after us, and paid and left before us. And they had bigger parties. I'm so disappointed, I usually like to come here for lunch or to watch the game, I will literally never be back. The most horrible service by Caitlin. She needs to either get a new job, or learn how to do hers properly.

Never again. Always loved Red Robin, it was THE meeting place when I came back in town to visit. Moved home and planned on making it a tradition for my family but not a great place for kids. We tried to order the kids meals while placing the drink order since even calling ahead at 9am to get a table doesn't do anything and we waited 40 minutes to get sat down. Not only did they not bring out the kids food first, they brought the drinks but not the milks. So table with starving kids, and everyone else has drinks but them. Took 2 hours from the time we walked in the door until the time we got our food. Unbelievable. I don't know why we have to tip, everything is done through the screens at the table and the runners bring out the food. Miserable experience. Even with the upgraded menu and renovations it's not worth going back, not an enjoyable experience and they for sure lost life long customers that day.

We came in expecting just a regular Red Robin experience. But, it was more than exceptional. My friend had a bad experience at another Red Robin and this location made it right. Shyenne was an awesome server and should get recognition. The manager Stanya was awesome as well.

Waited 8-10 minutes for our server to finally come up and talk to us, not to mention asking what we wanted for drinks. Burgers we got were small yet pretty good. Shout out to the bottomless fries w vampire sauce !!!! Bomb!!'
My son loves the chicken tenders here, the burgers are decent. I go here to satisfy my burger craving.  I usually get the blue cheese burger, they have no bun options too.

I love Red Robin but this was not a good experience. I came with relatives from Korea that don't speak English well and because of that, I feel like the waitress avoided our table a lot. She didn't ask us for refills, or bother getting my royalty card number. She dropped off our ticket and never came back to ask if we needed change. I'm mad that I didn't get to get my free burger, and couldn't use my purchase for a future free burger. I doubt I'll go back to this location!

Red Robin has always been a pretty consistent experience for me. It isn't too expensive, you get a good burger and their drinks are delicious (non alcoholic and alcoholic). Tonight when we arrived there was a big sign on the door that their liquor license has been suspended for 5 days due to sale of alcohol to a minor and they won't be serving alcohol again until the 26th. Luckily, I'm pregnant and wasn't there for a drink, just a bacon cheeseburger.  The host asked if we were over 21, we said yes and she sat us in the bar. Even though there's no alcohol I thought it was a little funny that she just asked if we were over 21 and didn't check ID, while their liquor license is suspended. We were helped quickly, they brought drink refills without being asked and brought fry refills without being asked. My husband got the wing appetizer and loved it. I got a lettuce wrapped bacon cheeseburger and the burger was done perfectly, the bacon was a little limp and sad but for $31 including my husbands shake, it cured the bacon cheeseburger craving. We will be back I am sure, but there are definitely better burgers around.

If your into greased soaked bun you'll love this place my mushroom burger bottom bun was so soaked it was soggy and turned to mush in my hands then the waitress threw are food on table glass of water dumped all over a friend and waitress said oops I'll get to that in a minute sorry then friends food was also soaked in grease food was not very warm and I will not come back they sat a group of 9 in a table for 6 so cramped and so not impressed

Ordered the bruschetta chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries. Server greeted me very promptly and with the biggest smile(her name was Kaelia if I remember correctly, very cute.) Anyways, food came quick even though the place was packed and I never ran out of water or ranch dressing. I highly recommend coming to this location as the staff is the best out of all the locations in the PNW. Oh, and Kaelia deserves a raise!
Very busy today with all the kids off from school on holiday. Restaurant is staffed for the crowd. Drinks kept full, service great and food brought to us quickly.

This is a difficult review to write because I have always enjoyed Red Robin in the past.  But our last visit earlier this week was very disappointing.  We were seated quickly in the newly refurbished dinning room which I thought was a big improvement from the busy Americana theme. The feel of the new dining room is really the only reason why I gave them two stars. It ends there. I'm going to begin my rant by saying I can't stand the video monitors at every table. Is this really necessary? Most of us spend way too much time in front of our smart phones, iPads, video games and televisions.  Of course, my children were drawn to the video monitors immediately. I put the stupid thing on one of our empty chairs. My next gripe was the ridiculous bells and buzzers going off in the kitchen constantly.  And the buzzer didn't ring for 5 - 10 seconds. No, the darn things kept going all night for 30 seconds at a time, not to mention they were very loud. No reason to have the alarms going off like that continuely, no matter how many french fries they're frying.  Then there was the manager standing directly behind me going over the nights staffing level and floor seating grid. I turned around because I was in shock they were talking so loud, so close.  The manager saw me turn around and look at them, " Oh, sorry folks" and continued on with their discussion. The serve reached across myself and my daughter to serve the two other meals. Really? Take two steps around the person and place the plates directly in front of each person. Terribly rude to reach in front of people. Had to ask for refills on ice tea, drinks more fries. I was beside myself by the time I walked out of the restaurant. Unfortunately, it will be awhile until I go back to RR, and definitely not the Auburn location. So disappointing because I really use to think  their customer service was on par for that kind of restaurant.
This is my favorite red robin to go to! It's always consistent and the staff seem to enjoy working here!

I'm giving this Red Robin in Auburn, WA a low rating.  There is no happy hour, no serior discount and there are only 5 mediocre beers on tap.  The beer is a little over priced.  On the bright side, the food (I had the french dip, my husband a salad) was good.  The things that came as side items were not great.  For example, the garlic toast was cold and soggy.  I could have used more juice for the sandwich, but by the time the waitress delivered it, the french dip sandwich had to be eaten dry.  It seems like they are going cheap on some things.  For example, there are no coasters for the beer mugs and we ended up having to use our dinner napkins to sop up the wet.  We had to borrow salt from another table which was embarrassing. We were in the bar area and it seemed a little chilly.  I wore my jacket through the meal and looking around, I saw other people wearing theirs.  Restaurants should be cozy and comfortable.  They had this computer on the table and we were encouraged to play games (for a fee), order and pay on the thing.  One way to cut staff and generate some money.  Also, I was sitting on a high bench against the wall, which kept wiggling around and I was afraid it was going to dump me.  The noise level was OK, however, and we did not have to scream at each other over sports or music.  For two and a half beers, a french dip and a salad, plan to spend about $55.  For a $55 meal, we left with more complaints and disappointment than compliments..  We will not be coming back here.  There are better places in Auburn.  I don't know if all the Red Robins are this way.

Joke...party of 8...must be the signal for bad service...food to slow in the making, to cold when arrived..yep thanks for saving me money..won't be back...my bill was $100.00+10.00 tip...nah you all don't need any more of my money...

We really like red robin burgers but this location has gone downhill. Used to come here twice a month but now three really bad experiences in a row. Place is filthy, workers visible in kitchen not practicing good sanitary practices, kitchen is slow and they've messed up my order three times in a row. We will keep eating red robin but not this location. Go to panera or qdoba next door if you want food in this vicinity.

My boyfriend and I have gone to this location of red robin a few times, and have had only one friendly waiter (Thaddeus.) We came here for dinner once on a Friday night around 7, so it was super busy. I got my refills on my lemonade without having to ask, and our food was out within 30 min. This is when Thaddeus served us. The next time we went (today,) was a Sunday night and there were only a few tables filled with about 6 waiters on duty (more than one waiter per table.) At first, our waitress was friendly and brought our drinks right away. After we ordered is when the service went to shit. We waited over an HOUR for our food on a slow Sunday night when they were overstaffed and when it finally came to us, it wasn't even fresh. My burger was luke warm, the fries were burnt and old, and my boyfriends bun was hard. I ate about half of my burger (I usually eat all of it, but I was hungry so I ate some) and my boyfriend had like one bite of his. We didn't even have napkins and silverware brought to us until I had to ask the waitress for them after we got our food, ate some of it, and made a mess. We also had to ask twice for buzzard sauce, and the waitress never once apologized for the food taking so long (even though it's not her fault.) On top of all of this, after I asked for the buzzard sauce for the second time, the waitress dropped a menu and (jokingly) blamed it on me. I realize she was trying to be funny, but I definitely don't think it's appropriate to joke like that when you know the customers are already upset and have been waiting for their food for an hour. I realize red robin isn't exactly gourmet, but I expect the food to be fresh, arrive in a timely manner, and have professional wait staff. From now on, I'll be going to the Bonney Lake or Covington location.

Okay, Let me start out by saying i LOVE red robin. However we will not be returning anytime soon. My husband and i went there for dinner. He had a 22oz beer and i had 2 absolute freckled lemonades(Strawberry Lemonade with Vodka). I ordered a 3rd drink and my husband ordered another beer. Our waitress brought me a 3rd drink and told my husband "Why dont you finish the one you have first".....umm im sorry i don't remember asking for your opinion.....So he finished his beer and when she returned he requested his second drink. She replied "how about some water"..... My husband is 6'7 280lbs and i am 5'6 200lbs...... Why was he cut off at his second beer and not me on my third drink. We requested a new server and the manger came and we explained how rude our server was being and he sided with her saying it is at their discretion when to cut the customers off.  I DO NOT recommend going here. Service is poor and they will not make it right if you have concerns.

I came here on my birthday which was last Saturday and I had a blast. Everyone was so helpful and had smiles upon there faces. I even got sung happy birthday and got my sundae. I had a cod burger, fries, milkshake, n water. I will be back again to this location.
Red ribbon did reach out and offered another experience.  A company that cares enough to do this deserves another star. I will dine with red Robin again soon but it will be another location.

We went here the other day and I dropped my husband and son off To go in and get a table. I parked and brought I our son. There was a line starting and my husband and son weren't in the waiting area but there were 4 staff at the podium where they take names totally oblivious to the world around them. I figured my family had been seated so I'd go find them. Turns out they were in the bathroom. We went back out front to find they'd skipped over us as we weren't In the lobby. I told the staff they were oblivious when I walked in and they said we thought you were going to the bar. Really?! I said how would I go to the bar with a toddler to which their response was we can't see kids over the podium. This makes no sense but if you can't see customers when they come in you shouldn't be working as a host. I did talk to the manager who said she'd talk to the staff but we won't be coming back.

Food is consistent and okay, but service is not great. Even though they have those tablets at every table now, calling the server with it doesn't even work if they don't notice the flashing light. Today, we had ours on for at least five minutes, but our server would never notice and come by. We were in a rush, so good thing you can pay on the tablet, or else who knows how long we'd be waiting to get our check.  Anyways, food was okay. Don't get the banana milkshake though, unless you want a liquified version of a banana Laffy Taffy. Not good and certainly not worth the price.

Crappy service, twice in a row. Both were to-go orders. First time I called 4 times, phone rang about 3 mins each time... Nobody is answering!! WTF?! They finally answered, and I was in the drive-thru at Panda Express already. Called and talked with the manager Alex. He seemed to care less. I assumed it was just a fluke, so forgave the situation entirely. Second time (2 weeks later)... Called at 4:10 to place an order. They said it would be ready in 10 mins.... I finally got my order at 4:35pm. 25 mins later!!! While I was waiting for my order, I sat next to this guy in the bar who was waiting for a beer for over 10 minutes. He had a dirty plate in front of him from the last customer, and the bartender was just counting money with her back faced to the bar the entire time. She didn't even turn around once to see if anyone needed anything. As you can imagine, everyone is sitting at the bar with empty glasses, like WTF?? Finally she turns around, and without a single apology, she asks with an attitude, "what do you want to drink?".... The guy next to me orders a beer, and looks over at me and says "I didn't realize I was such an inconvenience around here". That sucks. So finally my to-go order is ready, (25 minutes late)... I get home, and it's the wrong order. The receipt even says guac burger... And I have a turkey burger. Again, I call the manager to let them know what bad service is being provided at their restaurant... And I talk with Alex again. And again, Alex could care less. The reason I'm giving two stars is because their food is so good. The cooks do a good job in the kitchen. Good burgers and fries... just crappy service, and a manager who should care a little more. I don't know when I will be back. Maybe when they get some new employees, and a new manager.

Follow up to earlier review.  After emailing back and forth for several days with the corporate office about my experience, I was told someone from this location would be reaching out to me....still waiting, two weeks since the bad experience. At least 10 days since the corporate emails.  Hopefully this isn't a trend at all Red Robin locations and we can go to another location with better customer service and guest relations.  Very disappointed.
Came here yesterday, Malisa provided Excellent customer service!! It was quite busy but she handled it well. All of the people here make sure tables are satisfied.

Everytime I go to Red Robin I am really surprised at how dirty the employees keep it. This one, the one in Renton, and the one in Covington- always so dirty! The Auburn one was especially disgusting... as soon as I walked in, it smelled like burnt, greasy food. I don't think I will be coming here anymore.

Horrible service, got order wrong, promised fries but none delivered, waitress spilled food on one of the party members, promised a discount but never got one, promised a refund on my credit card....it has been 3 weeks.....worst food experience ever.....go to Southcenter or Federal Way

Went here with my son before he had his 18m appointment at the doctor. We were all excited to have fries and chicken.  We walked into the restaurant and two women were scrubbing the sign in board on the podium because someone wrote on it with a silver metallic marker...yes, I heard all of this because no one realized I was there nor dos they care after they looked up to see me holding my small child. Sad.   We were taken back to a platform table in the back of the restaurant where I needed a high chair. Little do they understand, is that when the high chair is placed at the table, it's about 6-8inches away and my child won't be able to reach the table. When I asked for a 'regular height' table, I was given the death glare and the hostess walked away. Granted, she looked like someone off the street. No uniform, and clearly no manners.  I ordered a bbq chicken wrap with no cheese, and fries. My son ordered the chicken stickens with mandarin oranges. When the food arrived after 25 minutes (my son was not happy by then), I noticed that my wrap tasted funny. I knew what was missing, the ranch/sour cream they put in the wrap. She almost acted like she knew it was missing, went over and got a dish of ranch and said sorry. Uhh...this was made wrong. If I wasn't short on time, being we had to be somewhere and small children only last for so long in a restaurant, I would have spoken up. This is one of the worst RR trips of what was supposed to be fun with just my son and I.  I will be sending this to corporate.

This is the 2nd time I've visited this location in the last couple of months.  It's bad.  It's really giving Red Robin, a bad name.  We love Red Robin and go often in our town.  This is the absolute worst RR that I've ever been to.  And after reading the reviews of similar experiences, I think Corporate needs to get involved to fix this location so it can live up to the Red Robin name.  Last time we were here the place was dirty and the waiter spilled water on my friend.  Accidents happen though.  But there was no real apology or concern and the food was not as good as other locations.  This time...oh boy!  The place wasn't busy, but the place was TRASHED.  Tables next to us were left dirty the whole time we were there.  The A1 peppercorn burger was luke warm and had just a couple onion straws on it.  Other locations load it up.  We also had a split check at our table and the waitress swiped one of our cards twice instead of using both.  So now we have to wait for the money to be out back into the account.  Or at least that's what she said.  Easy mistake for her and she was apologetic, it's just scary worrying about your credit card.  Then we can't use the tablet on the table and they said the batteries were not good or something.  So, obviously no survey, lucky for them.  I love RR.  This is so disappointing.

My girlfriend likes this place for lunch. We come maybe once a month only because I don't like it here but she does otherwise we would be here more often. She doesn't eat meat so she gets the veggie patties as a substitute for the meat and she loves it. So if you love veggie patties then this is the spot. There isn't a lot of onions and chunks of veggies in there veg patties. She also got the garlic Parmesan fries but she said they were bland and didn't have much seasoning on them. We got the chili cheese fries for an appetizer and they were ok. The cheese and chili wasn't mixed with the fries, everything was on top so as you got down more into the dish they were plain fries. As for myself I got a chicken Cesar salad. It was pretty bland with the dressing as it tasted watery. The chicken was actually really good, soft juicy and a nice size portion. I also got a cup of tortilla soup which tasted watery as well. Ther service wasn't good as our waitress seemed overwhelmed with customers. I ordered a drink and didn't get it until our main course came out. She never checked in with us to see how our appetizer was or our main course. I wouldn't recommend anyone to come here. I am giving two stars only because my girlfriend liked her veggie burger.

Very sad, I have been eating here since I was a kid and have never ever had a bad meal. Until today, what the heck happened to their burgers?! We come here for the big juicy burgers Red Robin is known for. Both my husband and I's burgers were TINY! They always ask if you want pink or no pink in your pattie, they didn't ask this time and obviously it wasn't needed.... Because it was only half an inch thick, and had no flavor. I was starving so I dumped ranch on it to help. The manager did kindly give us a gift card and promised the meat hasn't changed (which is why I gave it 2 stars for the giftcard) but I don't know..... There is a huge difference from what it used to be. Just look at the photo to see the thickness of that pattie. I can make a better burger at home, or even McDonalds has burgers with bigger pattys! So sad!

After our food was served we never saw our waiter again until we were walking out the door and he was serving another customer. A supervisor came by when she saw us start to use the pay at the table gadget and "told" us to give our absent waiter at least 8 stars or it counts against them. Yikes, bad management and service here!

We went to this location to have dinner before going to the movies and sat in the bar. The bartender was great, he got us drinks and took our orders timely. Our appetizer can out and that was right. Then our food can out...  My order was totally wrong but I was just going to deal with it until I took a bite and it was cold, so my boyfriend sent it back. Then when when they brought out the new food it was sitting in a pool a grease. At this point, I gave up on trying to send the food back again and just ate what I could. The ppl r nice but the food is horrible!

I just took my wife here for drinks, since it was the closest "bar" to where we were staying. The alcohol selection sucks, and the mai tai included very little alcohol (I'm guessing one shot). I would love to see some higher end alcohol options, particularly in the whiskey family. The bartender was nice, but she was very busy and barely paid attention to us. Overall, not a very good bar.

Had to get my own utensils and napkins. This place is very unorganized and the food tasted weird.  The waitress spent most of her time visiting with a customer and didn't even bring out the food. We should have saved our money and gone someplace else. It used to be a good place years ago and now just seems sad and bad.

Terrible service horrible leadership (Kathleen). When trying to complain of service this lady had the nerve to actually call me a liar stated she watched the waitress from the kitchen come over to us several times. (Let's just say I was wrong) customer is always right and she should have just apologized about the situation and we would have paid the bill and left.  But she wanted to argue that she watched the waitress check on us.  She assumed we just wanted a free meal!  I will not ever go back to this place and will be calling the GM and informing him of the type of leadership he has working there.

Been here a few times since we live close and today was the last time we will be going. Every time we have went something has always been wrong. I ordered a smoke and pepper burger and received a burger with regular bacon and not peppered bacon when I pointed this out to the waitress she was very polite and took it back. The manager came back with it and asked what was wrong and insisted it was right but clearly it wasn't then after putting his hands all over it asked me if I wanted it or if I wanted it remade .  . . . after 15 minutes got the right burger but as payback to me sending it back they poured salt in my patty. . I guess that's better than spit.. Also gave us the burger for free. The waitress was very sweet though.

We used to enjoy coming to this red robin but tonight was my last visit. Party of 5 on a Friday at 630pm. We were seated fairly quickly but the hostess acted like she didn't want to be there and I swear she rolled her eyes at us. Not friendly at all. From the time we were seated it took 35 minutes for our drinks and 45 for our food. Our fries were cold and mushy, burger cold and greasy. My daughter asked for a side order of fries and the server made sure to tell her that since she didn't order a meal, policy says the fries are not "bottomless". Ummm, they were cold to start with so ok?! Both men's and women's bathrooms had trash cans overflowing, toilet paper out and water all over the floors. Milkshake spilled on floor near kitchen and tracked out to restaurant. Sad because we used to live this place. Not sure what happened but it's not good.

Bottomless steak fries!  The service here is always a little off.. Slow waiters that forget to bring drinks and condiments..  Delicious crispy chicken burger. I once found a dead fly in my salad at this location though..

Good franchise, bad execution.  BBQ sauce wings were decent. My draft beer was also ok, but seems a bit watered down or the taps just need a little cleaning. My southern charm burger had amazing flavours. Bacon was sweet, and the onion topping was flavourful. The burger itself, kind dry. Overall, burger was OK. The dry meet kinda threw me off. Fries were OK.  -mild ranting and thoughts- Servers were very apologetic and tried their best to address some issues we had (late food, late drinks, etc). These things happen, so I'm pretty good about that, especially when it's a full house. So that's good. However, it was not busy, so why are you putting your servers in this position to begin with? There was a problem with communication between patron and staff. Please look into this.  Please remove the one centre table that is closest to the kitchen. It creates a narrow high traffic laneway for your server and guests to walk through. When your servers need to float drinks and food over the guests' head to get to the other side of the room, that's a problem. Your restaurant is not at capacity, consider using your space effectively.  $2 entertainment fee for the tablet/menu/game? Tablet sitting on the table, not being used by anyone. Your innovation should be used elsewhere. Don't find new reasons to charge your patrons. Period.  As noted by other reviewers, clean the tables in a timely manner. Doesn't have to be immediately, but...maybe within 30mins. Consider hiring a busser.  -rant over- Red Robbin is usually a pretty consistent and well run company. However, Auburn location, step your game up and fix these issues.
Great menu.. Nothing bad on the menu.. They have a sweet apple cider.Also lots of sauces for your bottomless fries..

Honestly the worst service I have ever had at a restaurant .. It took about 30 minutes to get our appetizers and about 10 to get our water.. My friends and I felt stupid for asking our server questions not to mention she only came back to our table 2 times before cashing us out.. She made the air feel very tense and awkward. It was my friends birthday and I asked our server if they did anything for birthdays and she said," ya but I don't know how many people I can get out here to sing." with an attitude... She came back with the sundae and set it on the table and walked away. Didn't even say happy birthday to her. We had to move tables because the booths' next to us had crushed food under them. Gross! I won't be back to this restraunt ..

My family and I went here to have lunch there are only three of us. Getting seated wasn't the problem. We get seated, decide what we want to order. We wait 30 minutes before the waitress comes up just to order drinks. She comes back 10 minutes later with the drinks and final takes our food order. We must've waited 35-40 minutes we finally get our food unfortunately they were cooked incorrectly and it was cold. We paid before they brought us the check and left our partially eaten food behind. Normally they are great. The place wasn't even that crowded.

Although the menu promised me 'pasta coated in a deliciously creamy five-cheese sauce and topped with perfectly toasted croutons crumbs, Parmesan cheese, and fresh parsley', what I was served was neither delicious nor topped with perfectly toasted croutons.  What I was served was soft noodles drenched in soupy, flavorless sauce, topped with a few soggy crouton pieces with no parsley in sight.  The plate the macaroni and cheese was served on was covered in bits of hardened cheese and broken French fry bits, with a mysterious green flake on the corner.  Looking at what I was presented with compared to the gorgeous picture of toasty, golden, cheesy macaroni, was quite disheartening.   The French fries served next to my entrée in a metal ring were room temperature, soft, unseasoned bits of potato.  In past experiences, the fries I received were large, golden, and delicious, coated in a scrumptious layer of salty herbed seasoning. However, the potato wedges I ate today were quite a disappointment. The larger fries were soggy, and the broken pieces were rock hard.   The restaurant itself was loud and crowded, overflowing with staff running about but not seeming to be doing much to help with the masses waiting to eat.  If the restaurant's goal was to create a crazy atmosphere, they succeeded.  My fellow diners and I were seated at a tiny booth next to the kitchen.  Not only was there a large open space looking into the kitchen about head height next to me, during the entire meal we could not hear ourselves speak due to the loud sounds and voices coming from the kitchen.  When I curiously peeked in, it was cluttered- stacks of bowls and plates of salad covered the counters.   Several minutes after being seated, our waitress brought the three of us two forks and one knife.  It took a long while for our food to come, and once we were served, our waitress only stopped by once to check up on us and, although our drinks were low, did not refill them until we were leaving.  When she brought us our bill, we were ready to pay almost instantly, but couldn't find the waitress anywhere.  After about ten more minutes, we managed to pay and leave.

Great staff and food! Got my usual Red Robin Cheeseburger medium, cooked just right with a little pink! Fresh hot fries, cold beers and tequila with the game on in the background. Service was quick and several staff members participated. K was a good waitress and Q, the manager checked in on how the food and service was - nice touch. One of the better RR spots, consistent with the franchise.

Overall, the restaurant was clean, the food was as expected, and the server was nice and attentive. However, the 2 stars is because of a mess-up at the host stand- that apparently no one thought to apologize for.  We showed up with 4 adults, a hungry 5 yr old, and a hungry 1 yr old. We put our name in- and watched them type in our name and indicate +1 high chair. They said 25-30 mins, so we took a seat right up front by the host stand.  Around 35 mins goes by, and I have to take the hungry/grumpy kids outside because they're so restless. The rest of our group stays inside, right in front of the host stand. The hosts never thought to ask why we were standing there, or for how long.  Finally, after almost an hour, someone from my group asks them why they keep seating groups who got there way after us-- they try to tell us that we weren't on the list...Too bad 3 of us saw her type our name in. When they finally realized their error, They didn't seem too bothered by it, and sat us soon after.  It may seem like a quick fix, but we waited there for 35 minutes longer than we should have-- and by that point, the kids were wiped out. Sort of ruined the dinner.  Also, no attempt was made by the server, hosts, or manager to apologize for their error. I'm not asking for a comped meal- a simple "sorry" would have been appreciated.

Okay, I'm not huge on really bad reviews but I was so disappointed in this Red Robin.  Came in for food and no hostess, while waiting for one watched the bartender 15 feet away put on deodorant behind the bar, sigh.  Finally someone came to seat us and in a mostly empty restaurant it took 10 min before we could even order drinks.  Very sad about the customer service when normally you are seated and immediately you can at least get a beverage ordered.  If anything in the area was even close to tempting we would have gone elsewhere!!  Used the women's bathroom which smelled of sewage coming back in the floor drains.

The food at Red Robin is always fine, but the service at this location has issues. Tonight a blonde female server forgot the lime for my corona, then went on to do a bunch of other stuff while I sat in front of a beer that I couldn't drink. She handed off our table to a guy named Will. Super nice guy, but he forgot the silverware, then went on to do other stuff while I sat in front of food I couldn't eat. When the silverware came, it was dirty.  When I dug into the macaroni, it had no sauce on it. It was just noodles and cheese, they had forgotten the sauce. That's two servers and the kitchen who all dropped the ball.  He brought a replacement, but it had sauce and not the delicious burnt crispy cheese that was the only good part of the sauce free version. The salad was clearly out of a bag, which is common in a chain, but the lettuce had been frozen and was brownish and a little slimy. Which means nobody looked at it before they poured it out of the bag into my bowl.  Super nice people. Not great servers. J

I've eaten here many times but this time was particularly bad. We had a party of 3, got seated at a dirty table, no silverware, we order a beer - 2 shakes and nothing complex. Our shakes came, melted almost instantly.. waitress had no concept of how to serve people. Then our orders came  and they missed garlic fries, bringing bottomless fries early (which we requested). My salad had barely any lettuce and more condiments than anything else and bottomless fries were not bottomless as we waited 20+ minutes for more. I typically am very generous about tipping, but Ashanti's willingness to be blasé and non chalant about messing an order up and saying "oh you order garlic fries, I didn't hear that" when she acknowledged our order specifications. Won't be eating here in a while. Very disappointed.

Party of 5- my husband and I and our 3 young children (ages 11,9,7). Waitress was really nice. We ordered our food and my burger had a long blonde hair~ the manager came out to apologize and brought me a new burger and I replied "don't worry about it, it happens" yes I did not make a big deal about it. The bill came $79, and my husband gave the waitress his credit card. We didn't realize that they charged us for the burger they had to remake (they charged us for the burger they threw away). After we pointed out the discrepancy the waitress said they "comped" the burger... which was funny to me because nothing was comped we paid for everything we ordered and they charged us for an extra meal. Long story short this wasn't a very good experience, but we had our kids with us so I made the choice to NOT make a scene. It is unfortunate that they didn't make it right, and to top it off messed up on our bill which won't be fixed for 3-5 business days. We won't be coming back here again.

If you are headed there for lunch during work rethink you choice. Waited 15 minutes for drinks and 35 minutes for food.  I paid with cash and took 10 minutes to get the change.  On the upside the food was good but not a good choice for lunch if you have a dedicated lunch hour.

Due to them Allegedly having a truly gluten free menu we opted to have dinner with 5 family members. After waiting 20 minutes to be seated, after another 20 we had to ask for menus and the server showed up after another 10 minutes. We ordered and it took another 25 minutes to get our food and drinks from the bar! Horrible service, food was mediocre at best. There was little alcohol in the drinks. As we were self checking out, the waitress had the audacity to ask us to rate her performance and informed us that anything below an 8 was a zero. Seriously!? We left no tip and will not be returning! Unbelievable! If I could rate zero stars I would.
The main dishes were served cold. Customer service was not the best the servers attitude was not helpful.

The service was not that great or attentive. I ordered a burger with sweet potato fries regular ones came. Refills had taken way to long and any extra sauces that you ask for never came tell you ask the 3rd time. Would not go eat there again.

Always seem to order the same thing.  The soup and sandwich combo.  But I'm always happy!! My husband ALWAYS offers the same too. Bonzai burger.  Only problem is they no longer serve ham on it. But still a great burger.
Great Burger Joint ;). I ordered the southern charm burger.  My wife got a salad with some mozzarella sticks everything was great.  Good service. Would come back again.

Do yourself a favor...go across the street to Jimmy John's or Panera. Horrible burgers, cold soup, "endless fries" only because they are so bad you wouldn't want any more! Don't waste your time or money! Red Robin USED to be dependable--not so much anymore-too bad!

Sunday night at 6:15 we stopped in with our 2yr old grandson.  We waited 20 minutes fir a table,as the hostess had informed us. We were seated in the back with 2 other tables and 2 different servers.  The servers purposely entered the area and never gave eye contact.  We then signalled for a server via the table electronic system....no server for 47 mins..Another table after us  was greeted served and ordered without eye contact by the server...I couldn't leave my 2yo to flag the manager.  My husband is disabled.  WE WALKED OUT...NO ONE NOTICED OR CARED.  MY GRANDSON WAS CRYING ONLY BECAUSE WE WERE LEAVING.  He had been playing with his toys we brought quietly for 47 mins.  He was upset not to get his milkshake we kept promising.... McDonalds served us in less than 10 minutes, were friendly, gave us eye contact and concerned about our order.....STAY AWAY or bring your own food.  Red Robin servers could care less...

This was a bad experience , we had to wait a long time and our waitress had no personality . Our food was cold and my family member had a dirty plate with dry sauce on it. I don't plan on coming back any time soon.

Great food and healthy alternatives. Lettuce wrapped chicken burgers 350 calories and less if you omit the bacon.I'm watching my salt so I requested no added salt. Im adding the nutritional menu for those who need or want to view that kind of thing.

Came in to take advantage of my "birthday burger" as part of the Red Robin Royalty club.   I ordered Royal Burger w/ egg over easy and my wife the California chicken w/ 2 sides of Chipolte sauce but we started with wedge salad for appetizer.  Bryan was our waiter, but needs some training. He brought my coffee, but no spoon to stir creamer/sugar. I used my fork, but had asked for spoon........nothing. It was taking some time (20 mins) to get our salads but finally arrived. 30 seconds later our entrees showed up by another server.  I asked that they be taken back and kept warm as we just got our appetizer salads.  He took it back to kitchen area. 2 minutes later, the manager brings entrees back out.  I asked if he was the manager, he said yes. I asked why he was bringing out our entrees a 2nd time when we had just got our salads and asked to have them taken back to keep warm. FYI RED ROBIN STAFF  appetizer defn: a small dish of food served BEFORE the main part of a meal.  In most restaurants salads are served first and after finished, the entree is brought out but not here.  Manager apologized and said he would have new orders made up. I asked for a spoon for my coffee which Bryan still had not brought. He said he'd get it. Nothing came.  Our entrees were brought out. The bun was off to the side so I started to align and realized that the egg white on top was uncooked and raw.  WTF?  FYI RED ROBIN STAFF Over easy definition, (of fried eggs) turned over when nearly done and fried briefly on the reverse side so that the yolk remains somewhat liquid but with a thin firm layer on top (NOT RUNNY WHITE SLIME RUNNING DOWN THE BURGER!!!) Manager came back over and asked if everything was ok, I said no, the egg white slime is running all over and it certainly wasn't cooked over easy, it was sunny side up.  I like a soft yolk, not a 1/2 raw egg.  I also pointed out that I was still waiting on the spoon for my coffee (now cold). He asked, "Didn't he bring it out?" If he had.....I wouldn't be asking for one.   He said he'd get one, 2nd time and he'd take care of the egg.   So I got to watch my wife eat her California chicken while I had to wait again for my entree.  I'm not sure they remade the burger but only recooked the egg as the burger was cold when I got it but at least the egg white wasn't running all over. I was so hungry at that point, I didn't care.  Bryan finally brought spoon and I pointed out that 1 of Chipolte sauce didn't taste spicy. It was visibly different than the spicy one, maybe it was 1000 island dressing.  He said he'd go switch it out.  It was taking quite some time & I thought maybe they had to make a new batch? My coffee ran dry and although Bryan walked by a couple of times and I put cup to edge of table, he didn't offer to refill. I had to walk back to kitchen to ask where I found him just chatting with other waiters.  He brought back coffee and I inquired about the Chipolte.  He said, he thought I'd just wanted it sent back. He said he'd bring it out, I said don't bother as we were done.  Nice timing though.  Manager took 20% off the bill, for my trouble, but won't be back here again. My wife said she even told the Bryan it was my birthday so they'd bring out desert and sing Happy Birthday. That didn't happen either.  Red Robin use to be a nice place to go for a good burger with fairly decent service but not anymore especially this one.  The waiter obviously needed more training, but manager really wasn't any better.

Yawn. Long ticket time. Cold food. Server was WAY too busy. The manager managed to refill my soda once. Our server did swoop in and ask if her manager refilled my soda. I said yes. She told me that he refilled it at the bar & the soda doesn't taste right from the bar. She brought me a new one. At least the refilled fries were hot....way to go Red Robin....that was the only hot food that landed on our table. I wasn't about to complain about our cold meals for fear of waiting another half hour for our food. Been to this location before but won't make that mistake again.

We live about a 5 min drive from here which is the only reason we go...the food? Meh it's ok...the service? So bad it's actually impressive. Like I don't even get mad at the servers and indifferent staff...I'm just surprised how terrible they are. Yesterday we waited for 10 mins for a table, once sat down, we waited 20 mins for our waitress to get our drink order. We put in our order and, my sister in law asks for fries while we wait along with the appetizer and  I ask for honey mustard on the side. While the waitress left I made a joke to my wife saying...now watch me ask for the sauce again. Appetizer comes, no sauce, no fries. Entrees come, no sauce. It's cool...I knew that would happen. I ask for a second time. Then my wife's burger was incorrectly made. I got 8 fries with my burger so I do the dance and ask for more fries. Blah blah blah you get it...it's bad. My wife's veggie burger was so under cooked she spent the rest of the day with a terrible stomach ache. Oh and the refills are a rare commodity. So drink very slow or you'll be eating ice. Then it's time to pay. No computer swiper on the table and the waitress says she's going to find it. 20 mins later we finally spot the manager who also didn't seem surprised by the terrible service.  I have like 5 other eerily similar stories like this. One of these days red robin, straight to the moon!
Burger fell apart so easily. It was a mess. My food also arrived cold including my "steamed" side of broccoli. Won't come back to this location again.

I wouldn't have expected Red Robin to go from such a past preserving restaurant to the modern day chain burger joint. Their food quality has diminished to that of Jack in the Box. I used to love their bottomless fries as a little kid! They would be fresh and burn your tastebuds as you ate them. Nowadays, their fries are microwaved it seems. Soggy and dull, like the frozen ones you eat from Wal-Mart when you're stoned. Not to mention my burger was unsatisfactory. The meat lacked flavor and my condiments were lacking freshness. Seemed like someone just threw lettuce on my plate as well. I probably won't be coming back again. Ever. Too pricey for lame burgers. I'll just get high and get some Wendy's next time.

I came in yesterday with a friend around 1:00pm, we sat at the bar. We both had a burger, I had a vodka soda with muddled limes and he had a beer. I asked for my burger to be cooked well done. It was not well done. In fact, any time I have ever come to any Red Robin anywhere I have never had my burger cooked the way I want. Service was okay tho.

Went here for lunch on a Monday afternoon so it was not busy at all.  I was really wanting a burger and it was a toss up between five guys and here...should of went with five guys. Was seated by the hostess and waited about 15 minutes before our waitress came she took our drink order and returned about 10 minutes later.  We placed our meal order being very simple 2 burgers I opted for the mac n cheese burger and guest got a smokehouse burger.  We waited another 30 minutes for our food to come out and had to flag down waitress to refill water n beverages. Finally our food....we recieved cold fries which I had to send back and ask for fresh ones and burgers were dry n lack any flavour I choose not to send my burger back due to the time ive already spent in this establishment for the crap they put on the table at this point I was just trying to leave. This by far the worst red robins ive been to..the people who work here need to be retrained.  When we were exiting our table we had another server come introduce herself like we had jus sat down and she was ready to take our order keep in mind the table was full of dirty dishes etc as we were done eating. You would think that on a slow monday a establishment known for burgers could of at least produced good burger and some hot fries...really not asking for alot.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY IN THIS PLACE

We came here for dinner on a Wednesday around 6:45 and it was quick to get in and get our drinks and orders in but that is when the waiting started... We waited a hugely long time for food. I asked for a refill on my drink (after it sat empty several times when the server came over) and the guy who asked if I need a refill (not our server) and was never to be seen again. After another longer wait, my server got it for me. Server asked us if we wanted more fries right after our food was delivered. We never got them. Actually she mentioned them several times and "would be right back with them" and 20+ minutes after her 3rd time of doing that (which we never saw her in that 20 minutes), she brought them to us as we were walking out. I should have taken the basket to my car and snacked on them on the way home.  Not impressed. She was friendly but the whole restaurant seemed off its game.

Me and my friend order a to go meals. This was on Thursday. We called in at 6:20pm to make our order. We had 2 burger to be picked up at 7pm. We only have a 30min lunch. We got there they ignored us for the first 7min. Then a lady started talking to us. She said we are cooking it now it will take 30 min. I have never been so upset at red robins in my life.. This was terrible. We gave them 40 min to prepare 2 burgers. Smh..

15 minute wait time to be seated, not bad.  We ordered quickly. After ordering a large party arrived and was seated next to us, mind you by this point we had already  asked for our fries early. My son had ordered a soda which never came. While we continually waited for even our fry basket to arrive the large party had been served appetizers and drinks. We had to ask for my sons drink three times before it finally arrived. I get that it's busy especially on Holidays but you can't forget the small parties, they are your clients too. All that said the manager stepped up and started handing our table. Suddenly things were happening, we got our food, and our experience greatly improved. The food was good as always and they were attentive to a party members food allergies. What started off as a negative experience was made right and I can appreciate that. The manager also discounted our meal because of the delays. My only suggestion would be to offer more assistance to servers handing sections with multiple large parties.
